title: op-exporter panics on requests during startup
body:
**Describe the bug**
While deploying a new version of the op-exporter, `0.5.2`, my first request to the endpoint after it is passing the healthechecks was a 502.

The logs contain
```
2022/01/03 14:56:53 http: panic serving 35.191.10.104:52077: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
goroutine 62 [running]:
net/http.(*conn).serve.func1(0xc00047d400)
        /usr/local/go/src/net/http/server.go:1805 +0x153
panic(0x13eae80, 0x1fc85f0)
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/panic.go:971 +0x499
main.healthHandler.func1(0x17309e0, 0xc000170700, 0xc0003ebd00)
        /app/main.go:67 +0x93
net/http.HandlerFunc.ServeHTTP(0xc0004bbd00, 0x17309e0, 0xc000170700, 0xc0003ebd00)
        /usr/local/go/src/net/http/server.go:2050 +0x44
net/http.(*ServeMux).ServeHTTP(0x1fe5e20, 0x17309e0, 0xc000170700, 0xc0003ebd00)
        /usr/local/go/src/net/http/server.go:2429 +0x1ad
net/http.serverHandler.ServeHTTP(0xc000170000, 0x17309e0, 0xc000170700, 0xc0003ebd00)
        /usr/local/go/src/net/http/server.go:2868 +0xa3
net/http.(*conn).serve(0xc00047d400, 0x1732f18, 0xc0001362c0)
        /usr/local/go/src/net/http/server.go:1933 +0x8cd
created by net/http.(*Server).Serve
        /usr/local/go/src/net/http/server.go:2994 +0x39b
```


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Kill the running pod
2. Watch new pod log exceptions until it fixes itself

**Expected behavior**
The healthcheck should fail until the the exporter is ready to serve requests.
The app should start in a coherent state, if possible.
